conversation.content: No, no, this can't be right. [confused] These booking confirmations don't match the airline records at all. [pause] Wait, let me check this again. [anxious] The Johnsons' trip to Bali, the Martinez honeymoon package, the... [trailing off] [gasp loudly] Oh my God. None of these reservations exist. [shaky voice] Marcus has been— he's been taking their money and just sending them fake confirmations? [long pause] [angry] Five years. Five years we've been business partners and he's been doing THIS behind my back? [shouting] These people trusted us! [frustrated] Mrs. Chen called yesterday crying because her hotel said they had no record of her anniversary booking, and I told her it was probably just a system error. [bitter] A system error. [laugh] God, I'm such an idiot. [upset] How much has he taken? [quickly] Twenty thousand, forty, wait— [gasp softly] it's over sixty thousand dollars. [very quietly] My name is on this business too. [panicked] They're going to think I was part of this. [speeding up] The reviews, the lawsuits, the— oh God, what if they arrest me? [cry] I worked so hard to build this agency. [furious] And he just destroyed everything for what, a new car? [pause] [exhausted] I have to call every single client. [sigh] I have to call the police. [very sad] How do I even explain this to people? [whispering] Their dream vacations, just... gone.
